snippet: The world’s largest semiconductor maker is struggling to adapt as PC sales collapse, users rely more on mobile phones and tablets, and cloud computing expands.
abstract: Intel is struggling to adapt its business model as proliferation of mobile devices and cloud computing hurts demand for semiconductors that made it titan of PC industry; company is continuing to search for replacement to longtime CEO Paul Otellini that will spearhead shift.
lead_paragraph: The world’s largest semiconductor maker is struggling to adapt as PC sales collapse, users rely more on mobile phones and tablets, and cloud computing expands.

headline.seo: Intel Tries to Find a Foothold Beyond PCs
headline.main: Intel Tries to Secure Its Footing Beyond PCs
headline.print_headline: Intel Tries To Secure Its Footing Beyond PCs
